    • Method Detail

      • showClassHierarchies

        @RequestMapping
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.hateoas.PagedResources<ClassHierarchy>> showClassHierarchies(@RequestParam(value="pageSize",required=false)
                                                                                                                                                 java.lang.Integer size,
                                                                                                                                                 @RequestParam(value="page",required=false)
                                                                                                                                                 java.lang.Integer page)
        Returns a ResponseEntity object containing a page of ClassHierarchy, as HATEOAS PagedResources, with the optionally specified page parameters. The optional size argument specifies the page's size, must be an integer value. Defaults to '10'. The optional page argument specifies the page number. Must be an integer, Defaults to '0'

        This is mapped to the '/classhierarchies' route

        Parameters:
        size - the size of pages you want returned (optional, default 10)
        page - the page number, for the given size (optional, default 0)
        Returns:
        the ResponseEntity containing the page of ClassHierarchy Hateoas Resources

      • getClassHierarchy

        @RequestMapping(value="/{id}",
                method=GET)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.hateoas.Resource<ClassHierarchy>> getClassHierarchy(@PathVariable(value="id")
                                                                                                                                                                                    java.lang.Integer id)
        Returns a Response Entity containing a ClassHierarchy object, as a HATEOAS Resource, with an id value matching the given id parameter. The id argument corresponds to the 'id' PathVariable from the RequestMapping, '/classhierarchies/{id}'
        Parameters:
        id - the id value of the ClassHierarchy you are requesting
        Returns:
        Response Entity containing the corresponding ClassHierarchy, as a HATEOAS Resource

      • createClassHierarchy

        @RequestMapping(method=POST)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> createClassHierarchy(@RequestBody
                                                                                                                  ClassHierarchy classHierarchy)
        Attempts to Create or Update a ClassHierarchy in the ClassHierarchyRepository. classHierarchy argument is a ClassHierarchy object with an optional id field. The ClassHierarchyRepository will attempt to save this object. If given an id value, it will attempt to update the ClassHierarchy with corresponding id. If id is not given, will create a new ClassHierarchy with a generated Id and specified values.

        Mapped to the '/classhierarchies' route POST request

        Parameters:
        classHierarchy - the ClassHierarchy object to be created/updated
        Returns:
        a void ResponseEntity with a NO_CONTENT status

      • deleteClassHierarchy

        @RequestMapping(value="/{id}",
                method=DELETE)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> deleteClassHierarchy(@PathVariable(value="id")
                                                                                                                                                    java.lang.Integer id)
        Attempts to delete a ClassHierarchy from the ClassHierarchyRepository. id argument is an integer specifying the id of the ClassHierarchy you wish to delete.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the ClassHierarchy to be deleted
        Returns:
        a void ResponseEntity with a NO_CONTENT status
